titleStmt.title: The gelding of the devil. Or, The prettiest jest that e're was known, how the bakers wife her skill hath shown, then listen a while, and I the news will tell, betwixt the baker and the devil of hell. To a dainty new tune called, The gelding of the devil: or, The card players.

notesStmt.note: Verse: "A pretty jest I will you tell ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
